TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit CommunicationObject extends System.Object implements class System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject

Docs.summary: Provides a common base implementation for the basic state machine common to all communication-oriented objects in the system, including channels, listeners, and the channel and listener factories.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> class implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject> interface for all communication objects in [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)]. The method implementations handle parameter validation, raise events that notify the occurrence of state transitions, provide the means to associated additional processing with these state transitions, and ensure that such state changes are coordinated.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(object mutex) cil managed

Docs.param: The mutually exclusive lock that protects the class instance during a state transition.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the mutually exclusive lock to protect the state transitions specified.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Abort() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes a communication object to transition immediately from its current state into the closing state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method indicates that any unfinished work should be ignored or ungracefully terminated before returning. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Abort%2A> method can be used to cancel any outstanding operations, including outstanding calls to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Close%2A>.
To gracefully transition a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> from any state other than <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Closed> into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Closed> state, call <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Close%2A> or one of its asynchronous versions, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.BeginClose%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: public IAsyncResult BeginClose (AsyncCallback callback, object state);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.IAsyncResult BeginClose(class System.AsyncCallback callback, object state) cil managed

Docs.param: The delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous close operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous close operation.
Docs.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.
Docs.returns: The that references the asynchronous close operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method causes the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> to gracefully transition from any state, other than the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Closed> state, into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Closed> state within a default interval of time. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.BeginClose%2A> method allows any unfinished work to be completed before returning. For example, finish sending any buffered messages). This method calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnBeginOpen%28System.TimeSpan%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> if the communication object was initially in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opened> state.

The communication object is in a state and cannot be modified.
The default interval of time that was allotted for the operation was exceeded before the operation was completed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnBeginOpen%28System.TimeSpan%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> method calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpening%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnBeginOpen%28System.TimeSpan%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> if the communication object is initially in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Created> state.
To insert processing after a communication object transitions to a closing state due to the invocation of a synchronous <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> operation, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method causes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> to gracefully transition from any state, other than the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Closed> state, into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Closed> state. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Close%2A> method allows any unfinished work to be completed before returning. For example, finish sending any buffered messages.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> enters the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Closing> state and remains in it after the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Close%2A> method is called until the transition to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Closed> state is completed. The transition consists of making successive calls to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnClosing%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnClose%28System.TimeSpan%29>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnClosed%2A>.
There is also an asynchronous version of the close method that is initiated by calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.BeginClose%2A>.

Docs.exception: The communication object is not in a or state and cannot be modified.
The communication object is in a or state and cannot be modified.
The communication object is in a state and cannot be modified.
The default interval of time that was allotted for the operation was exceeded before the operation was completed.

Docs.param: The that specifies how long the close operation has to complete before timing out.
Docs.summary: Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state within a specified interval of time.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Close%2A> method allows any unfinished work to be completed before returning. For example, finish sending any buffered messages.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> enters the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Closing> state and remains in it after the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Close%2A> method is called until the transition to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Closed> state is completed. The transition consists of making successive calls to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnClosing%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnClose%28System.TimeSpan%29> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnClosed%2A>.
There is also an asynchronous version of the close method that is initiated by calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.BeginClose%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnOpen(valuetype System.TimeSpan timeout) cil managed

Docs.param: The that specifies how long the on open operation has to complete before timing out.
Docs.summary: Inserts processing on a communication object after it transitions into the opening state which must complete within a specified interval of time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> method calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpen%28System.TimeSpan%29> (after calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpening%2A> and before calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpened%2A>) if the communication object is initially in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Created> state.
To insert processing as a communication object transitions to a opening state due to the invocation of an asynchronous <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnBeginOpen%28System.TimeSpan%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> operation, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpening%2A> method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This provides a way to add processing when it is called by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.EndOpen%2A> methods.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnOpening() cil managed

Docs.summary: Invoked during the transition of a communication object into the opening state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This provides a way to add processing when it is called by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.BeginOpen%2A> methods.

Docs.summary: Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When called, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> method causes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> to enter into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opening> state and calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpening%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpened%2A>. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpened%2A> method completes the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> method by setting the state of the object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opened> state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Open() cil managed

Docs.summary: Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> is instantiated, it begins in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Created> state. In the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Created> state, the object can be configured (for example, properties can be set, or events can be registered), but it is not yet usable to send or receive messages. When called, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> method causes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> to enter into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opening> state and calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpening%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpened%2A>. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpened%2A> method completes the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> method by setting the state of the object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opened> state.
In the
<xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opened> state, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject>is usable (for example, messages can be received), but it is no longer configurable.
There is also an asynchronous version of the open method that is initiated by calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnBeginOpen%28System.TimeSpan%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> and completed by calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.EndOpen%2A>.
### Credentials Capture with Windows Authentication When using Windows authentication, credentials used by the service are based on the current context thread. The credentials are obtained when the `Open` method is called.
> [!NOTE] > For asynchronous calls, credentials are captured when the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.BeginOpen%2A> is invoked. However, the actual credentials cannot be guaranteed. That is, the credentials of the caller may be switched to another identity. For more information, see [Message Security with a Windows Client](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/message-security-with-a-windows-client.md).

Docs.exception: The communication object is not in a or state and cannot be modified.
The communication object is in a or state and cannot be modified.
The communication object is in a state and cannot be modified.
The default interval of time that was allotted for the operation was exceeded before the operation was completed.

Docs.summary: Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state within a specified interval of time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> is instantiated, it begins in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Created> state. In the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Created> state, the object can be configured (for example, properties can be set, or events can be registered), but it is not yet usable to send or receive messages. When called, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> method causes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> to enter into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opening> state and calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpening%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpened%2A>. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpened%2A> method completes the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> method by setting the state of the object to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opened> state.
In the
<xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opened> state, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject> is usable (for example, messages can be received), but it is no longer configurable.
There is also an asynchronous version of the open method that is initiated by calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.BeginOpen%2A> and completed by calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.EndOpen%2A>.

Docs.exception: The communication object is not in a or state and cannot be modified.
The communication object is in a or state and cannot be modified.
The communication object is in a state and cannot be modified.
The default interval of time that was allotted for the operation was exceeded before the operation was completed.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a communication object transitions into the opened state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Opened> event is raised by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpening%2A> method which is called by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.EndOpen%2A> methods.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a communication object transitions into the opening state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Opening> event is raised by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnOpening%2A> method which is called by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.OnBeginOpen%28System.TimeSpan%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> methods.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates the current state of the communication object.
Docs.value: A value from the enumeration that indicates the current state of the object.

Docs.summary: Gets the mutually exclusive lock that protects the class instance during a state transition.
Docs.value: The mutually exclusive lock that protects the class instance during a state transition.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void ThrowIfDisposed() cil managed

Docs.summary: Throws an exception if the communication object is disposed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks No exception is thrown if the communication object is in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Created>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opening> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Opened> state. A communication object is disposed once <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Close%2A> is called on it.

Docs.exception: The communication object is in a or state.
The communication object is in a state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void ThrowIfDisposedOrImmutable() cil managed

Docs.summary: Throws an exception if the communication object the property is not set to the state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Since an object is immutable after <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A> is called on it, the only state that is both mutable and not disposed is the <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState.Created> state.

Docs.exception: The communication object is in a or state.
The communication object is in a or state.
The communication object is in a state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void ThrowIfDisposedOrNotOpen() cil managed

Docs.summary: Throws an exception if the communication object is not in the state.
Docs.exception: The communication object is not in a or state and cannot be used.
The communication object is in a or state and cannot be modified.
The communication object is in a state and cannot be modified.
